snippet: The Georgia Supreme Court ruled that a law outlawing the promotion of assisted suicide was unconstitutional, a decision likely to shape the national debate over the practice.
abstract: Georgia Supreme Court rules that a state law outlawing the promotion of assisted suicide is unconstitutional; many on both sides of the issue say court's decision will change the course of the national debate over the practice.
lead_paragraph: The Georgia Supreme Court ruled that a law outlawing the promotion of assisted suicide was unconstitutional, a decision likely to shape the national debate over the practice.

headline.seo: Assisted Suicide Law in Georgia Is Overturned
headline.main: Georgia Court Rejects Law Aimed at Assisted Suicide
headline.print_headline: Georgia Court Rejects Law Aimed at Assisted Suicide
